Topic.Title: [Resolved]Using the webplayer to run a specific file on localhost.

Posts.EditableText:
When I use the webplayer, properly compiled and navigate to this:  http://localhost:52426/Play.aspx?id=1 it returns:
Loading...
No game specified.

I do have a game in the game folder called test1.quest
Am I missing anything?

      <lockingModel type="log4net.Appender.FileAppender+MinimalLock" />

Posts.EditableText: Now, one last hurdle. Anybody knows how to save locally? If I can figure this out, then I can host the game on my own website.
Posts.HTML: Now, one last hurdle. Anybody knows how to save locally? If I can figure this out, then I can host the game on my own website.

Posts.EditableText:
I think it checks if you are logged into textadventures.co.uk first, even when running locally. I got this:
```
Saving game...
Failed to save game: You are not logged in. Please log in at textadventures.co.uk and try again.
```
But when I was logged in:
```
Saving game...
Failed to save game: Failed to save game.
```
So you may have a number of issues!

Or use a different save/load system..?
https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Save-and-Load-Library
Posts.HTML:
I think it checks if you are logged into textadventures.co.uk first, even when running locally. I got this:

Saving game...
Failed to save game: You are not logged in. Please log in at textadventures.co.uk and try again.

But when I was logged in:

Saving game...
Failed to save game: Failed to save game.

So you may have a number of issues!

Or use a different save/load system..?
https://github.com/ThePix/quest/wiki/Save-and-Load-Library

Posts.EditableText:
Thanks a lot for your help :)

Yeah, I am not too sure about the limitations of the save/load.

I might just host the game in an unsaveable state, more as a demo and go like "If you want to keep playing, download Quest and the file."

At least, now I can show the game without a login wall, which is often time a large deterrent to have people try the game in the first place.

Posts.EditableText:
I was able to package the player and have it run on a Windows Server 2016 install using IIS. WebPlayer is now accessible from the outside and the game is fully functional... except saving.

I'll try to get a local save library working, but it would be great if somebody could build a library so that it can save on the server. So if somebody save, they can assign it a name then can load using that name.
Posts.HTML:
I was able to package the player and have it run on a Windows Server 2016 install using IIS. WebPlayer is now accessible from the outside and the game is fully functional... except saving.

I'll try to get a local save library working, but it would be great if somebody could build a library so that it can save on the server. So if somebody save, they can assign it a name then can load using that name.
